Description: Textile fragment; small rectangular fragment of undyed linen cloth (now grey-cream in colour); medium to fine quality; edges cut and torn. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.36 ends per 10mm and weft 18 picks per 10mm. Holes partly due to insect damage.
Curator's comments: Lightness of colour is distinctive and is matched by some Old Kingdom and Middle Kingdom cloths. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1992]
